page.title: 02Ecology in the Twyford Area
page.content: In our rural block it is a familiar sight to see{small mammals}such as rabbits,foxes and hedgehogs.There are various small ponds,ditches and a river which supports a variety of fish,water birds and amphibians.There is a scattering of trees along hedges and in fields.In the last few years Dutch Elm Disease has wiped our elm trees.Public footpaths or bridleways link Twyford to Godington,Twyford to Three Bridge Mill,Twyford to Cowley Farm.There are many other short footpaths.The climate averages 25 inches of rain a year,summers can be wet or dry,summer temperatures of 22,23 degrees C are good.Short cold spells of -10,-12 overnight occur in winter.A small amount of air pollution is received from the local brickworks and the straw burning at harvest time.
